website_summaries.verdict: Cotton/silicone mitts with puppet gripping style for those who have trouble with typical mitt design.
pros: Heavy cotton mitts with puppet-style silicone grips
Grips are textured to prevent slipping
Come in black, sage, red, gray, beige, aqua, and rust

customer_reviews.title: Well constructed, but deeply flawed.
customer_reviews.text: I want to congratulate the engineers at Cuisinart with discovering the worlds slipperiest substance and applying it to the these oven mitts. The cloth part is ideal, its comfortable, heavy duty, and feel very well made. However, the black silicone part is incredibly slick. The texturing doesn't help at all either, they're slippery silicone grooves that just make big sliding pads for anything you're trying to hold. I would stay away from these.
customer_reviews.author: The Asian Kid

customer_reviews.title: Ripped after 3 months.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my wife to replace an ancient pair of oven mitts that developed a hole. At first, I thought these were great. Within three months, I noticed a rip (and these definitely do not get every day use). And the rip continues to spread. These are terrible quality and will not last. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Bob S.

customer_reviews.title: Not even 2 weeks old and already coming apart!
customer_reviews.text: Stuck home in quarantine I needed to replace my old oven mitts that I had had for several years. I liked their silicone grips so bought these due to a similar design, good reviews and the Cuisinart name. They were much more expensive than my last mitts, but with all the stores closed I bit the bullet. At the top tip of the left mitt where the fabric joins the silicone the fabric is already pulling away exposing the white padding inside. The heat resistance is excellent, but the durability of the item stinks. In short, they are overpriced cheaply made gloves. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: njbritchick

customer_reviews.title: a little awkward but great protection
customer_reviews.text: These mitts offer great protection. Since I've been using them, I have not suffered any of the annoying yet small burns that come with cooking regularly. The only drawback that I have experienced is some awkwardness in gripping bake ware that I would normally pick up with my thumb on the inside and my other fingers on the outside of the rim. I'm also very conscious not to put my hand too far down the inside of the rim whenever there are running hot juices or bubbling sauces in the pan. I don't want to stain the mitts willy nilly.
customer_reviews.author: justbeinghonesty'all

customer_reviews.title: Silicone started to break away after 1 month of use
customer_reviews.text: Limited durability, silicone part started to break away after only 1 month of use. It is not easy to clean since there is the silicone part that should not be put in the washing machine but then you have the cloth part that needs machine washing since the rim of silicone that meets the cloth is right on the edges of where you get the most contact with food when removing from oven.
customer_reviews.author: BKF

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, but fell apart after a few years.
customer_reviews.text: Ours lasted for a few years of light use, and then the inside lining of the glove wore through and came loose, so that my fingers were touching the silicone grip from the inside. Naturally, that happened while I was holding a 450 degree cast iron pan, and I burned my fingers (though fortunately, not too badly, and I didn't drop the casserole). I checked the other mitt, and it was in the same state of disrepair. So, they were okay, but just not built to last.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Best oven mitts I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: After 40 years of cooking, I've finally found the best oven mitts ever. The silicone pads are supple and still effective at resisting heat. The mitts go on easily but are long enough to stay on well. The metal ring makes hanging them up a no-fuss affair (fabric hoops are a bit difficult to get on the hook sometimes). They are well-insulated. I hesitated to purchase these because of the price, but they are worth every penny of it and I expect they will last a long time, too.
customer_reviews.author: Awesomesauce Mom

customer_reviews.title: Good, but one tore within a month
customer_reviews.text: Was excited to receive new oven mitts, but within a month, one of them has had the black rubber pull away from the red fabric. I can't say that they were over-used in that month (we kept using our old ones, forgetting we had these); however, it's sad to have one "broken" piece. Would have considered returning, but honestly is too much hassle. Will continue using the damaged/defective one until it gives up (or things get too hot). Hopefully others don't have this issue and we just got a fluke. Have to say, tho, that the red color is beautiful, and the mitts are nice and thick. Just wish they both were in perfect working order.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Clumsy to use
customer_reviews.text: I am sorry I purchased these mitts and should have stuck with the cheaper type. They are non-slip but they are also very stiff and hard to manage. They might work for a heavy roast pan but they don't work for my cookie trays or pots with handles. I would send them back but by the time I got all the plastic ties off , etc. it is easier to just keep them. I will probably give them to my son who does a lot of outdoor cooking.
customer_reviews.author: GrammaD

customer_reviews.title: Slippery
customer_reviews.text: The actual hand grip section is a bit slippery and if you are picking up a large pot with a long handle such as a carbon steel pan it can rotate in your hand if not careful. Otherwise the gloves are exceptionally safe from any heat source. I got mine dirty from the grill surface and just used a little soapy water and they cleaned up nicely. I would highly recommend these gloves
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality oven mitts / sock puppets
customer_reviews.text: My previous set of oven mitts were cheap and had seen better days. My girlfriend and I had both nearly burned ourselves through the mitts, so they had to go. Cuisinart is a trusted brand, and these are quality oven mitts. These keep out the heat very nicely, so no more burns! On a side note, my girlfriend likes wearing these like sock puppets, and what's not to like about that?
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Not great quality--resulted in burned fingertips.
customer_reviews.text: I like the look of these, but when I went to take something out of the over the other day, my fingers in one of the mitts started burning! I let go right away and good thing it wasn't too serious, but the lining of the mitt is starting to come away from the silicone grip on the inside, so there is no protection from the heat at that point. Disappointed as I've only had these for a couple months. They are probably going to be returned.
customer_reviews.author: AKshopper

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: We needed new oven mitts and these were the perfect replacement! The material is extremely durable, better than any other oven mitts I've ever owned. The inside of the hands have rubber to protect your hands from the heat. I also love how long the mitts are. I feel like I can stick almost my whole arm into the oven and I'm still protected. These are well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: lilg05

customer_reviews.title: Awesome high-temperature gloves
customer_reviews.text: I love these for their color and how well insulated they are. I can grab things straight out of a 500F oven and the rubber grips are very nice for holding onto hot items. The cloth part is not as heat-resistant and we have accidentally bumped the cloth on the oven heating element and scorched the gloves a little bit, but they still are functional. Love the blue color, and my husband frequently borrows them for grilling. Highly satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: RCary

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in the poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these in March to replace the Calphelon mitt that after 8 years tore at the thumb. Low and behold, one of the mitts is already falling apart! These aren't exactly cheap and I don't recommend them. It's not like we use them to play baseball or anything, we need them to remove things from the oven. And seeing how from May until now, we don't use the oven as much because it is so very hot in n Chicago! I would like a replacement if that possible.
customer_reviews.author: Lynette Cipun

customer_reviews.title: Great Oven Mitts
customer_reviews.text: I had one by KitchenAid for yrs that worked very well and was my go-to mitt, but recently stitches on the silicone started unraveling, so my hubby found these for me and I’m happy with my new oven mitts. They are easy to use, made with good materials, and not as bulky as some I have used before. These fuys will be my new go-tos!
customer_reviews.author: HJ

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Great oven mitts. I bought these to replace some old cloth oven mitts and it was a great upgrade. The silicone on the hands helps grip hot pans and protect my fingers. I don't worry about getting burned when I have these on. They are also very comfortable inside. The only thing about them I am iffy about is, they are a little bit small. I have to force my hands inside them, not aggressively but they are snug. I don't find it to be much of a problem because it gives me a better grip on whatever I am picking up. Overall good purchase and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: BryanS

customer_reviews.title: Poor Durability
customer_reviews.text: The cotton lining in these oven mitts wears out a lot faster than any traditional oven mitts. One of mine lasted maybe 8 months, the other a year, before I started burning my fingertips while wearing these. Absolutely do not recommend unless you want to replace them every year.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Excellent! My Forever Oven Mitts
customer_reviews.text: These are the best oven mitts! The silicone is grooved for superior grip and slip resistance. The fabric is thick, yet pliable, making them easy to use. Very heat resistant. I recently changed color in my kitchen so replaced with this beautiful blue, so the red are going to my daughter-in-law who is thrilled to have them. Long lasting and sturdy. Well worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: For Such a Time a This

customer_reviews.title: Not True to Color
customer_reviews.text: The color displayed in the images is a much lighter soft green than what was delivered. The true color is bright green. I was looking to match this with my towels and was literally the same next to my images on my computers (compared to professional images of the towels not my own). Hope they ensure their images and colors are genuine in the future. The glove feels a bit unnatural in the hand but other than those two qualms, I am very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Janelbell

customer_reviews.title: Hole in One
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure why amazon wants me to rate the warmth of ... heat resistant gloves ... but my biggest complaint is that even before a wash the fabric came undone from the silicone piece of the gloves. So far it’s only on one side, but you can definitely feel the heat if that area is closer to the heat source.
customer_reviews.author: Hayley

customer_reviews.title: protects hands well
customer_reviews.text: This pair replaces a pair we used for years. The inside material had finally worn out. The new ones seem as good as the old. 400 F pans right out of the oven are no problem at all. Great heat resistance. I don't put these in the washing machine, so they are a little harder to keep clean.
customer_reviews.author: Chips

customer_reviews.title: Scorched my hand
customer_reviews.text: Had these for a year and 3 months and they already fell apart at the seams. Unbeknownst to me who put them on to get a cake out of the oven and burned the explicit out of my hand. I had cheaper ones than this that lasted for 5 years
customer_reviews.author: Raven

customer_reviews.title: Great heat resistance
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace my standard Walmart oven mitts. These are fantastic! They are long, almost coming up to my elbow. The heat resistance is great so far, with things around 350 to 400 degrees. I haven't had a chance to cook things at a higher degree to test the gloves. For standard dinners, I don't even realize I am pulling out a piping hot dish with these gloves. It resists the heat far better than I expected. I highly recommend these oven mitts if you often feel the heat seeping through your current oven mitts.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Neatherlin

customer_reviews.title: Not so great if you're folding them over and hanging them on ...
customer_reviews.text: My last oven mitt had to go, as the part where the thumb meets the rest of the glove got a hole. Almost burned my hand. This one comes with TWO, and the handy metal rings so you can hang your mitts. Not so great if you're folding them over and hanging them on a bar (as they're pretty thick), but if you have a bar anyway, you might as well get a shower curtain ring and hang the mitts off of them. They deal with heat very well, with the silicone grips not being too slippery. What else can you say, great price, great value, and quality built.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Cute, but can’t clean them
customer_reviews.text: I like the look and feel of these. However, they are difficult to clean. The directions say to hand wash and Lay flat to dry. I did hand wash and tried to get as much of the water out by wringing them. I laid them out to stay, but they were just as wet aster a couple days. I did end up putting them in the dryer and it took 3 cycles, one of which I turned the mitts inside out, to completely dry. And of course this shrunk them.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Derenthal

customer_reviews.title: Hard to pick things up
customer_reviews.text: These are very good mitts in terms of protection from heat. However, it is hard to pick up anything that doesn't have a handle. The mitt's "hand shape" is not very defined. I'll keep them for the grill, but will need something different for handling oven dishes (casseroles).
customer_reviews.author: BBmb

customer_reviews.title: Too tight to use
customer_reviews.text: Unless your hand is the size of a 6yr old's, this will be too tight to use, especially if you wash it. The color is great but completely useless if you can't get your hand in!
customer_reviews.author: Jack Frost

customer_reviews.title: Great oven mitts, love the grips. A little on the small side.
customer_reviews.text: These are great oven mitts. My wife and daughter love them, and the silicone grips definitely make them a cut above your average oven mitt. Only issue is they are slimmer/smaller than you'd expect. My hands are bigger than average for a man, but not dramatically so. Yet I can just barely use them, and they're harder to get on than I'd prefer. So I'd recommend them for anyone unless you've got bigger than average hands. Should work fine for Donald Trump, for instance. ;)
customer_reviews.author: M. Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Great but they have started to show wear!
customer_reviews.text: Overall my favorite oven mits because they make it easy to pull things from a hot oven while still protecting your hands and arms, unlike a traditional pot holder. If you bump an edge of a pan you won't get burnt wearing these. I wash these in the washing machine and let air dry. They are nice and thick but have holes coming through! Disappointed given the price I paid for them. If they had not worn so in the year that I bought it I would have given more stars.
customer_reviews.author: RT

customer_reviews.title: good protection
customer_reviews.text: I like this type of oven mitt best because both left and right handed people can use it easily and comfortably, which means they are more likely to be safe from burns. Holds up really well, just throw in laundry to wash up. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Hull

customer_reviews.title: Narrow wrist openings make this a tight fit when in a hurry
customer_reviews.text: These are slightly too narrow in the wrist area to slide hands into quickly if you're in a hurry. In addition, I'm used to the standard mitten format that has the thumb to the side which is more natural for me. It all around felt awkward to wear. If you're used to this style, it probably won't bother you but just be aware of this if you aren't.
customer_reviews.author: Bryon

customer_reviews.title: I initially had reservations on whether these mittens would protect ...
customer_reviews.text: I initially had reservations on whether these mittens would protect my hands from the heat. They were effective in handling the heat without problem. I cook on the grill often and sometimes use pots directly over the flames. There was not problem removing the pot from the grill. No burns and could not even feel the heat.
customer_reviews.author: Scribo

customer_reviews.title: Really small where your fingers go
customer_reviews.text: Got these because I liked that they are longer, but I literally have small hands like wear small womens gloves and my hands feel jammed into these, it's ok for a quick use but it's hard to just slip them on fast. I wouldn't buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: EllieA

customer_reviews.title: Scored!!! (with my boss)
customer_reviews.text: Got them for my baker,.. wife say's she love's them! Her comments: "The gripping area is pliable and not too hard. Well insulated from heat also." As long as they keep my Love's little hands safe and she's happy, I'm happy! To me they do look of much better quality than some of the other's she has. One pair is more like plastic than soft silicone. These have better stitching and made of better quality material. Not as thin and flimsy. Well padded.
customer_reviews.author: J B

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that it is more form fitting to hands and your arms and hands are protected from heat. The design for the silicone hands is clever because it not only provides extra protection from heat but grasps the pans securely without concern of dropping it.
customer_reviews.author: moskqq

customer_reviews.title: Delightfully flexible and Easy Put On
customer_reviews.text: You know the minute you pick them up that they are the ones! Slipping your hands inside and flexing them shows how much better they will grip any shape dish or pan than the stiff kind. Then removing very hot things from the oven sells them! No kidding I would buy them for my mother. I urge you to choose the Cuisinart oven mitts.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Coppess

customer_reviews.title: Best oven mitts I have ever purchased!
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing quality, super well sewn and thick sturdy material without being awkward and bulky! I bake almost everyday so a good set of mitts are very important. The silicone grippy part allows me to get a handle of small objects like a 3 inch ramekin which is great. Used it yesterday with the oven on at 475 and my hands were cool as a cucumber, this is the only oven mitt that I have ever used that did not transfer any heat at all to my hands! Buy them you wont regret it!
customer_reviews.author: FrenchieSkylarWhite

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: My only complain is that the grip when grabbing things feels a little mushy compared to past gloves, but this is definitely more insulated. I can now pick up my cast iron without worrying and hold it long enough to pour/scoop food out. The rings to hang the gloves are made of metal, which, if you hang it above your oven like I do, end up getting hot. If you place this somewhere, I'd recommend not above heat. I don't have much of a choice due to wall space, but I may have to find another solution. Overall, I'm very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: N. Chambers

customer_reviews.title: beautiful & functional
customer_reviews.text: really like these - they're completely heat-proof, fit my husbands big hands & yet still fits my small ones. easy to grab edges of pans & love the color. they hang in my kitchen & look great even after using. quality oven mitts
customer_reviews.author: Lynne E.

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: After using these oven mitts several times while baking, I can say I am very happy with the product as is my husband. It fits us both well (I wear small or medium size winter gloves, he wears large.) I love that the mitts reach half way up my forearm and I feel safe reaching into the oven. I have never felt the heat from a dish being pulled out of the oven. It's the first time I bought mitts with silicon and I like it much better than the quilted type ones I had always used before.
customer_reviews.author: Fari

customer_reviews.title: A decent pair of oven mitts
customer_reviews.text: The silicone on the end does an excellent job protecting my hands - way better than our old pair of mitts. There's a little metal ring on the end of each mitt, which makes it easy to hang them on a hook instead of taking up precious drawer space. We've had these for a few months by now, and they're still in excellent condition. Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: I don't like the look of the oven mitten things that seem ...
customer_reviews.text: These oven mitts are awful. I am going to repeat, awful. My last pair looked similar to this, but were almost 10 years old. I don't like the look of the oven mitten things that seem to be popular. So I tried these. The inside lining got holes in it almost immediately where your fingers go. Guess what that means for your fingers when you pull a pan out of 400+ degree oven? HOT. HOT. OUCH. I would never buy these again, and wouldn't buy them for anyone I know, even if they asked me to.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Quality Construction
customer_reviews.text: The Cuisinart Mitts are very well constructed, long enough to protect ones forearms when reaching deep into the oven and the silicone grips offer outstanding thermal protection and provide a sure grip. The puppet design is somewhat awkward (unless one was born with a lobster claw deformity of the hands) and does take some getting used to. They are a tight fit for people with large hands (I wear a 8 1/2 glove size and can just fit into them). Overall a good value and should last years.
customer_reviews.author: BTNMD

customer_reviews.title: Work well, but limited motion.
customer_reviews.text: These work well as hot pads/oven mitts but you're a little limited in what you can do without fingers. The silicone is thick, though, and I never felt the heat of the pan (as opposed to oven gloves which you can). I kept one and gave one as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon SuperReviewr

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart after just four uses!
customer_reviews.text: The seams are already coming apart. We’ve only used them four times. These mitts work fine as far as preventing burns, but they are not durable.
customer_reviews.author: Buildable

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as advertised, but can be functional in certain circumstances
customer_reviews.text: Portion of the glove that must handle the hot product are very stiff and while it may not slip, it is tough to grip. Do not recommend for seniors who may have difficulty in grip due to arthritis or other similar issues.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Gregorash

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't buy again
customer_reviews.text: Very awkward small mitts. I have small hands and they were super tight to get on. Also, burned myself because while the mitt itself is thick, the silicone was too thin.
customer_reviews.author: Niki Torres

customer_reviews.title: after 3 years it didn't protect me from a hot pan
customer_reviews.text: i went to take something out of the oven and it seems that i crack in the rubber part of the glove formed and i almost dropped the pot. not realizable - should this be effective after 3 years? now need to buy a new pair; i'll try another brand.
customer_reviews.author: A. M. Kalish

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised by these - excellent form and function
customer_reviews.text: I thought these would be good, but discovered they are wonderful. The silicone is perfect and I don't feel hesitant to pick up extremely hot items. Sometimes my hands will be a little wet with cooking or washing them and with regular oven mitts, that means you get burned, since the heat travels quickly on anything wet. That's not the case for these oven mitts. They are also nice looking and we even hang them on a lower cabinet door, because they look so nice in the kitchen and have a big ring to hold them. These are real winner for us!
customer_reviews.author: lani girl*

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but a little small for a man's hands
customer_reviews.text: Nice mitt, but firta a little small. The 'touch' and feel' is not as goos as some others I have tried in the way one grips items in the oven. Thethumb does not feel quite right and natural. The insulation material seems a bit thin, but for short periods holding something hot, it has not been an issue.
customer_reviews.author: planedriver

customer_reviews.title: Good mitts
customer_reviews.text: Nice oven mitts. Very thick but easy to pick up and hold items. Only negative is they are a smaller size if you have big hands you will not be able to use these.
customer_reviews.author: stephen morehead

customer_reviews.title: Returned This Item
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this oven mitt set as a gift and returned it as soon as I received them. The purchase price was very good and these appear to be a good quality item. The problem I had was that these are very large (in both width and length) and very heavy. If you have large hands and are looking for oven mitts these would probably be great for you they just didn't work for me. One additional con I was charged a $4.00 re-stocking fee for the return of this item.
customer_reviews.author: SlothMom

customer_reviews.title: The BEST!
customer_reviews.text: I will never use a regular hot pad again! While these are large, they protect your hands and lower arms. The grips are perfect for pulling out shelf and grabbing your pans. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: kjm

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE** Durability Issues.
customer_reviews.text: Too small for my hands but they fit my wife perfectly. EDIT** 12/12/16 After some good use the inside lining started to fall apart leaving your fingers to touch the silicone directly. Heat does transfer right through and we have almost dropped hot dishes coming out of the oven. They were good while the lasted but I have to bump from 5 to 3 stars for durability. They lasted about 6 months of typical kitchen use.
customer_reviews.author: Svenska

customer_reviews.title: Decent Mitt, Durability is a concern
customer_reviews.text: Similar to other reviews, one glove had a liner tear after 10months that you had to be careful of. The other finally tore after about 20 months. Not sure if that is the lifespan of these or not but I will be trying a different brand this time around. If the liners weren't so bad these would be great. The grip is excellent, the rings are nice for storage and they look great.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Silva

customer_reviews.title: Great oven mitts!
customer_reviews.text: So we've had the same oven mitts since we were married seven years ago. My husband loves to cook, but pays less attention to details like taking care of the oven mitts. Needless to say, he's left them places, caught the ones we still had on fire, etc. So, after looking at our old ones and deciding they looked disgusting, I look a leap of faith and bought these. They're excellent. Supposedly they can withstand 500 degree heat...we shall see about that in the future I'm sure. But right now we love them.
customer_reviews.author: Hallie M. Isadore

customer_reviews.title: Works for what we need, a little tight for bigger hands.
customer_reviews.text: If you wear XL gloves, these will be a bit tight for you. Wife loves them since they fit her hands perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob H

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy oven mitts
customer_reviews.text: I love these oven mitts. They provide the perfect amount of coverage and the hanging rings are very useful.
customer_reviews.author: 504Runner

customer_reviews.title: Slippery!
customer_reviews.text: The silicon pads used to grab and lift the hot pots are actually very slippery. This could lead to a bad accident. They actually feel like they have been waxed or oiled. Too dangerous to use.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Monahan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I love these gloves. They work well in every way possible. They are comfortable, maneuverable, and keep your hands cool when handling hot objects. Couldn't ask for better.
customer_reviews.author: Diane L. Cass

customer_reviews.title: Thick mitts
customer_reviews.text: I love these mitts. They are so thick and with the non slip silicone it’s great for handling large to small items. Easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: margaret siemer

customer_reviews.title: Can not recommend, designing quality oven mitt should be fairly easy ...
customer_reviews.text: They were ok while they lasted, 3 months and the inside has separated and warn from the rubber grips, so know when you try and use them on hot objects the protection isn't there. Can not recommend, designing quality oven mitt should be fairly easy these days with the selection of materials and tech available. These do not measure up.
customer_reviews.author: The Iceman

customer_reviews.title: Great oven mitts
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my daughter and liked them so much, purchased a pair for myself. Well made and they fit. I have petite hands and most oven mitts are too big. These are not a sloppy fit. I bought the turquoise color both times. The material on the palm side is great using in the oven.
customer_reviews.author: Anne W.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality! love how there is rubber and grip to grab things with! Nice and thick material too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't dissappoint
customer_reviews.text: We were using cotton oven mitts for a while but the problem is I can feel the heat in a couple of seconds when I hold a hot baking tray. This product does what it is designed to do - it protects your hands and arms. In addition, it has nice colors and it's easy to wash. Will buy it again if this one is too old.
customer_reviews.author: Boshi

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality, But Too Small
customer_reviews.text: These seem like great quality oven mitts, and they fit like a glove. (I wear a size medium garden glove, btw). However, that is also the problem. My husband wears a size large garden glove and can't get his hands inside these mitts what-so-ever. Unfortunately, it's been too long for me to return these, so they'll probably end up at the local Goodwill store.
customer_reviews.author: flcowboy7

customer_reviews.title: Nice but wish they could be longer and more comfy
customer_reviews.text: They are a beautiful ORANGE but unwieldy to use because of the way the silicon is connected to the fabric. The metal hanging rings are awesome, but leave the gloves gapping open for food to fall into off the counter unless they are hung with the thumb facing the cabinet door.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Work as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: After my boyfriend and I both suffered burns thanks to our cheap-o oven mitts we decided to invest in nicer ones and these are miles better! After several months of use I have no complaints, they work exactly as hoped and don't seem to stain much either. Plus, thanks to the texture of the heat resistant palm area, they can also be used to open stubborn jars. Very happy with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Fits small hands only
customer_reviews.text: If your a man with average size hands they will not fit. If they were larger I would give them 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kirchmeier

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I got these because I burned myself on a cast iron pan, using old oven mitts that didn't have the silicon grip. I like that there is two in the set, so I'm never grabbing for kitchen towels if I need two hands on a hot pan. I also like the mitten shape (rather than the glove shape with the thumb to the side). Haven't felt any heat through the silicon so far, I'm not afraid of getting burned anymore! If I recall the price was fair as well.
customer_reviews.author: K. Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother
customer_reviews.text: These were not well-made and did not hold up well at all the inside lining completely fell apart so the heat would go through the silicone pads I would not recommend these I use oven mitts constantly and these are probably the worst I've ever had and I never even put them through the washing machine.
customer_reviews.author: Pinkgirl22jg

customer_reviews.title: Great Heat Resistant Mitts - while new - ask me in 10 years
customer_reviews.text: My son burnt our 2 year old single heat resistant mitt by laying it onto the gas stove top, so needed a replacement. This pair will last a little longer I hope.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Make sure about what you need , before ordering.
customer_reviews.text: They didnt work well for me . I needed something to pull stuff out of a toaster oven , a mitten with a thumb was what I wanted. These would be good for handling large pans.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Aronoff

customer_reviews.title: Great mits
customer_reviews.text: Great non slip, non burn handles. Will last a long time I believe.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Coyle

customer_reviews.title: Plan to lovingly hand-wash and air-dry these if you don't want them to shrink.
customer_reviews.text: So, silly me: I imagined that a heavy-duty kitchen item could go in the washer and dryer, especially if it's the sort of thing made of cloth that is liable to come into contact with food. Nope. If you dig around inside the mitt, you will see the label telling you to HAND WASH them. Sure, they are heavy-duty, but since they now fit no one in the house--and I have small hands--I am afraid the next step is discount mitts with chickens on them from the local dollar store. Perhaps this is a "status" mitt not meant for rugged, everyday use. At any rate, out they go.
customer_reviews.author: Caveat Emptor

customer_reviews.title: They work great, however
customer_reviews.text: I got two sets of these. They work great, however, the fabric lining inside one of my mitts has come away from the seam at the fingertips and I can definitely feel heat through just the silicone. I think another one might be close to doing the same thing. It's the best mitt I can find though, so I'm ok with it (especially since I have another pair!). The mitts that have the neoprene do not hold up well at all, and that's all that most stores sell. I would buy this product again for sure!
customer_reviews.author: RW

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I'm very please with these oven mitts. To be fair, they are a little narrower than the old "crab claw" types I've had before. But, once I got used to the slight bit of extra work slipping them on they are a lot better. Other men may have the same issue, though my wife finds no such challenge, and most women probably won't.
customer_reviews.author: Curmudgeonista

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: We bought these over a year ago and love them. They have not had any problems and I’ve never felt heat through the glove when using.
customer_reviews.author: Ln11

customer_reviews.title: Good product good seller
customer_reviews.text: I can't answer most questions bc I haven't had them very long. They seem well made and work great. So far so good
customer_reviews.author: elle

customer_reviews.title: Good protection
customer_reviews.text: So far, has protected me from burns! I love the fact that it has loops - I can hang them on the kitchen knobs below the oven!
customer_reviews.author: CDWorld

customer_reviews.title: Nice Mitts
customer_reviews.text: These oven mitts hold up to any temperatures that I roast, braise, bake, etc. at. They appear to be relatively durable as well. I took one star off because the thumb portion of the mitts are large enough that it can be difficult to keep from dipping them slightly into casseroles as you take them out of the oven. Maybe that's just my technique, but I seem to do better with mitts that have smaller thumbs.
customer_reviews.author: Mark C. Weber

customer_reviews.title: very nice quality, my only complaint is that they are ...
customer_reviews.text: very nice quality, my only complaint is that they are hard to put on because they are too small for my hands. Oven mitts are usually larger diameter and not problem putting on but these are difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Hall

customer_reviews.title: These are the best oven mitts
customer_reviews.text: These are the best oven mitts. I bake all the time and have gone through dozens of mitts -- what I love about these is the silicone. No burned holes -- I can't even feel warmth through the pads. And they're machine washable, and have already withstood many washings. Will buy these from now on.
customer_reviews.author: YMW

customer_reviews.title: I love them! husband does not
customer_reviews.text: theyre perfect for me, but my husbands hands dont fit. in their defense, hes a giant haha
customer_reviews.author: Lucille Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: I really liked the design of these mitts but after a short ...
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the design of these mitts but after a short period of time we noticed a gap or extremely thin spot in the grip portion of the mitt that let the heat through instantly. Disappointing manufacturing. :(
customer_reviews.author: RainRiverOcean

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: Fit myself and hubby. As advertised and love the medal ring to hang
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Gettmann

customer_reviews.title: These are perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent grip, and heat resistance. So much better than the side thumb mitts. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Chris Berger

customer_reviews.title: To small
customer_reviews.text: It could work better if only it would fit! I don't have big hands but I struggle trying to put these on.
customer_reviews.author: Karyn

customer_reviews.title: No more hot spots
customer_reviews.text: I love this mitts. They are a little large of you have small hands, but they still allow you to manage hot dishes with ease. I originally gave these to my parents for Christmas, but I love them enough to get a pair for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Amazing shopper

customer_reviews.title: What junk! I've had these for less than a ...
customer_reviews.text: What junk! I've had these for less than a year and already the inside lining has worn away. of course the only way to find this out is while trying to hold on to a hot pot and burning my hand in the process. Wish I could return them -- in fact I will write to Cuisinart to complain.
customer_reviews.author: chavala

customer_reviews.title: Functional and cute!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE These oven mitts! I actually burned through a prior rubber pair of a different brand. Don't see any chance of that happening with these. Love the red color. Bought green and blue for mom and sister they are so great!
customer_reviews.author: aciras

customer_reviews.title: Not Bulky
customer_reviews.text: These are comfortable, have great heat resistance but still not bulky. I can grab smaller handles and slide under cookie sheets without any issue. I highly recommend these but that’s obvious with the 5 Stars.
customer_reviews.author: Northenscold

customer_reviews.title: They work well, and match our utensils. Keeps the wife happy.
customer_reviews.text: It's a little hard for me to fit my big hands into them, but they function quite well. I am 6'3, and my hands are quite large, so I don't think Cuisinart should be held responsible for that :).
customer_reviews.author: Robert Schuller

customer_reviews.title: Really disappointing. Within a month or so of purchasing ...
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointing. Within a month or so of purchasing, the sewing on the fabric loop that holds the metal loop came unstitched. Not a huge deal, I resewed it. Then the other one went. I did same. I've had these for just over a year now, and they've received regular but not heavy use in my home kitchen. Now the inside lining has worn through around the tips of the gloves so that my fingers touch the silicone grip. The silicone alone does not provide enough heat protection for my hands and they are now unusable.
customer_reviews.author: JoanneLovesCoffee

customer_reviews.title: Cute and durable
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my mother-in-law two Christmases ago and she still uses them! They look great, cute color, and work well. Would buy and/or gift again.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda D.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: These are great. I’ve had them for at least a year now and use them almost daily, still like new. Good fit, durable, can hang on hook
customer_reviews.author: Yasmina Ferraris

customer_reviews.title: nice material and a reinforced silicone grip
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this on a lightening deal but feel they are worth at least the full price. Longer cuff then some, nice material and a reinforced silicone grip, looks good, it's a winner. The nature of oven muffs are that they get icky looking and need replaced. Nothing more embarrassing when family dinners are at my home then to have sad looking oven muffs. I'm all set for the next diner with these.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia R. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty mitts that are easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty mitts that are easy to use. They fit my hand well and I can easily handle my heavy, hot cast iron. I'm taking off a star for holes in the fabric for the plastic tags. There is no way to remove the tags without leaving puncture holes behind. Please redesign packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L. Dodd

customer_reviews.title: perfect length/type-
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to replace the gloves I bought a few years ago (the heat resistant pads had worn away). I didn't realize finding long puppet oven mitts would be so hard, but these did the trick! I am not sure how well these heat pads will last- they seem thinner than my old kind, but they do the job for now. I love the long length and the puppet grip style, and that the pads have texture to prevent slipping. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JLC

product_meta.title: Cuisinart Silicone Oven Mitts - Heat Resistant up to 500 degrees F Handle Hot Cooking Items Safely - Non-Slip Grip Oven Gloves with Soft Insulated Deep Pockets and Convenient Hanging Loop - Green, 2pk
product_meta.description:
Color:SageImagine the aroma in your home from delicious pie baking in the oven. The oven timer beeps and the pie has turned a glowing, golden brown. It’s ready. Take all the stress of removing the hot pie dish from the scorching oven with these Cuisinart Oven Mitts / Gloves.

Insert your hands into the cotton lined deep gloves and grasp the hot dish with the flexible silicone that is heat resistant to 500 degrees Fahrenheit. The premium polyester filling provides pure protection and safe insulation from hot items. This oven mitt set allow you to get a secure hold on the cookware you are carrying, so there’s no risk of dropping your delicious pie.

Meanwhile, the deep pockets point your hands away from the hot item so as to reduce the risk of any hot steam or grease contacting your skin. These oven gloves are great for added protection to your forearms.

This pack of 2 Oval Mitts are ideal for holding pasta dishes, pots, plates, bowls and so much more. They allow you to grip a variety kitchen items and utensils of different sizes to protect your hands from extreme temperatures. We also find them useful for opening hard-to-open jar lids because of the ripped silicone texture that grips so well. 

They are designed to suit many décor styles and can be stored neatly in a drawer or hung using the handy sewn-in hanging tab with metal loop. The mitts are easy care – hand wash and lay flat to dry.

Cuisinart – savor the good life. Cuisinart luxury performance kitchen textiles offer a new level of quality, durability and style. Our products are built for comfort and long lasting performance. Enjoy! 

The colors you see on your screen may not be a totally accurate reproduction of the actual product. We strive to make our colors as accurate as possible, but screen images are intended as a guide only and should not be regarded as absolutely correct.
feature_bullets: HEAT RESISTANT SILICONE OVEN MITTS - this set of two glove shaped potholders are heat resistant up to 500 degrees F and provides added protection to your forearms to help you safely handle hot kitchenware items coming out of the oven or microwave

KITCHEN ESSENTIAL FOR HOME COOKS / BAKERS - if you are removing a baked pizza or cast iron skillet from the oven, a pan or pot from the stove top, a bowl of soup from the microwave, items from the grill, these Cuisinart hot pads and oven mitts are a must

PROTECT YOUR HANDS AND ARMS - designed with you in mind, each pot holder is lined with super soft cotton and premium filling for insulation to protect your hands, arms and fingers from heat, steam, and grease - no more worries or risk of burning your skin

NON-SLIP RIBBED GRIP - these kitchen pot holders are made with FDA approved and BPA-free 100% flexible silicone to ensure you get a secure grip on your cookware items. Each mitt can be used on your left or right hand, ideal for when you’re in a rush

CONVENIENT AND EASY-CARE - pot holders and oven mitts take a beating in the kitchen, so stains are inevitable. To care, simply hand wash and lay flat to dry. Includes a metal hanging loop to easily hang for easy access or store in a drawer

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,523 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
